intro: Dyssodia micropoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dyssodia, is a small, herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Dyssodia micropoides is adapted to survive in harsh environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
